page.title: 09Church & Chapel
page.content: {FRISBY CHAPEL The original chapel was built in 1810 and the present building in 1888. There are twenty seven members and it comes within the Melton Circuit. The minister in charge is Rev.Vernon Cracknell who lives at Asfordby . {FRISBY CHURCH The building dates from between 1200 when the lower part of the tower was built, and 1500 AD. The church was built of iron stone and parts refaced with Weldon stone. Inside are many items of interest including stained glass windows and carvings in wood and stone. The present vicar is Reverend Graham Spencer whose parish includes Kirby Bellars. He is also a member of the Melton and Framland Team Ministry. There are forty two members on the Church Electoral Roll.
